intro: Tetrantha suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented tetrantha, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that emit a fragrant aroma. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Tetrantha suaveolens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along streambanks.
